Topic.Title: World Wind: In Case You Didn't Know

Posts.EditableText:
I just heard about this piece of software put out by Nasa, and I have to say I'm impressed. Simply put, it's an impressive 3d globe. The images it gives you have to be pretty recent too because, well, here's an example.

[url=http://s88880570.onlinehome.us/img/wwsample.png:2crd93dj]Truck from World Wind(1.61mb png image)[/url:2crd93dj]

[url=http://s88880570.onlinehome.us/img/wwtruck.jpg:2crd93dj]Truck from my window[/url:2crd93dj]

Sorry for the crappy shot of the truck, it was on my mobile and shot through a glarey window.

You can find the World Wind site [url=http://learn.arc.nasa.gov/worldwind/index.html:2crd93dj]here[/url:2crd93dj]. The program is about 250mb to download I think, but can use upto 2gigs(or whatever you specify), as it downloads the images from the satelites servers on demand and deletes least used map/image data. Definitely cool if you are into this sort of thing.

Posts.EditableText: Also, the software was announced on slashdot, which has effectively "Slashdotted" a few of the satelite servers. If you are a slashdot patron, for shame, you assholes ruin everything.

Posts.EditableText: how did you get so close to your house? the closest i get to places is using the place finder
Posts.HTML: how did you get so close to your house? the closest i get to places is using the place finder

Posts.EditableText: Zooming in, look at the key map. Find a monement or land mark you recognize and follow it to where you want to see.
Posts.HTML: Zooming in, look at the key map. Find a monement or land mark you recognize and follow it to where you want to see.
